result.execSummary:
The defendant David N Erdman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $500.00 BAIL APPLIED TO Court Costs and DNA. Balance of $18.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Provide DNA Sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time (nonworking hours) W/Huber. COMMENCE 3/03/2015 by 6pm. With Standard release conditions. Last 5 days STAYED to be used at Agent's discretion. Huber/straight time at discretion as well.
Sentence to be transferred to Washington County.
Concurrent with: sentence in Washington County.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David N Erdman in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 17.  Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant given form to provide DNA sample and form for ID processing. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 17:
-  Withheld sentence STAYED for 18 months Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 - balance of bail to be applied - balance of costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - apply bail
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.t.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.

 -  120 days jail Condition Time with huber (nonworking hours) commencing 03/03/2015 at 6:00 p.m. concurrent with sentence in Washington County. Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Last 5 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion and huber/straight time to be used at discretion of Agent. Sentence to be transferred to Washington County.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David N Erdman in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are ready to enter a plea. The State's offer is not consistent with the Defense's offer. Defense needs to speak to DA Opper. Court will set this matter over for 1 week.  Forms to be kept in the file.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on February 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant David N Erdman in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date. Defense needs to review discovery with his client. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on January 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant David N Erdman in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on October 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Refund the balance of bail that is already posted.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with  any co-actor, victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant David N Erdman in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bail set at $1,000
